reviews.text: Couldn't ask for more from a hotel. Very clean rooms and grounds, beds were super comfy, nice pool area, wi-fi worked well with no interuptions, FANTASTIC VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY HERE!! There is also a Denny's next door and minutes from a Target, Marshalls and lots of restaurants.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY IN HOLLYWOOD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every staff member at the hotel was wonderful. The hotel was very clean and well taken care of. I loved the fact that each staff member that we crossed paths with greeted us with a smile and a "hello".
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Parking needs to be better enforced, cars park in drive ways and fire lanes making it difficult to get in/out from the back parking area. Smokers out side door ways causing the smoke to enter the room from under the doors and having to walk through them to get out to the parking area.
reviews.title: Personal

reviews.text: Just spent a week in L.A. I booked this hotel on another site and we were pleasantly surprised. This hotel is in a great location. Its just off the highway and easy access to all the tourist spots we wanted to visit. The first night we got there at 1:30am so parking was a little tight. The desk clerk was quick to come out and help us find a spot to slide into for the night. The rest of the time we had no problem finding a parking spot. The room was clean. It had 2 sinks which is a great plus. The beds were super comfy. We didn't have any problem with traffic noise. The pool and spa were well kept. Be sure to visit the Galleria just down the street. You can eat at The Cheesecake Factory, El Torito (happy hour is from 3-8 with cheap drinks and appetizers) and others. A Target store is also just down the street from this hotel. The only negative I could find was the shower head was old. No biggie! I can't say enough good things about this hotel and I will be back for sure!!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very central location. Very clean! Helpful staff. Nice furnishings, great vanities (soaps,etc.). Reasonable rates. Parking ample. 9/10. Its a Grand Slam! Oh yeah, Denny's next to/attatched. 2 min. Drive from the Sherman Oaks Galleria.
reviews.title: Fresh and clean

reviews.text: The front desk clerks were courtesy and helpful upon arrival and departure. The room was clean and decorated nicely. The beds were comfortable and I liked there were 2 sinks in the room. The location was in close proximity to Universal Studios and Hollywood. There is a Denny's onsite which was nice to eat before heading out. And also the parking was free. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: A restful and comfortable overnight stay

reviews.text: The room was adequate, but room charge seemed too high for quality of the motel. Couldn't make outside call because they had changed their phone system and not updated the instructions in the room. Convenient to have Denny's there for breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: OK but overpriced

reviews.text: I have stayed here about a dozen times a year over the last decade and this hotel has never failed to provide a great experience. It is conveniently located for easy access to locations along either the 101 or 405 freeways. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and when possible are happy to accommodate special requests. There is a restaurant on the property that is of reasonable quality. The rooms are excellently furnished with a great bed and lots of pillows. Nice TV and internet is sufficiently fast to allow me to do work when necessary. Only disappointment is that no microwave oven is available in rooms, which for a 'Plus' hotel is lacking, at least many other Best Western hotels provide this service. Nevertheless I would not hesitate recommending this hotel.
reviews.title: Best Western Carriage Inn, Sherman Oaks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room here for about $110 through Kayak. I think next time we'll spend a little more and go somewhere else... the rug had sticky stuff embedded in it, they had cheapo toiletries; one of the towels smelled like cheese, and (really unforgivable) there wasn't any hot water when I took an early shower. I mentioned this to someone else who had stayed here previously; his theory was that they turn off the water heater overnight to save money - and turn it on again only when someone complains in the morning. On the brighter side, it wasn't too noisy; we got a decent night's sleep; and both the staff and the other guests seemed to be OK folks.
reviews.title: Not so great

reviews.text: During our last night in Los Angeles we stayed in the Best Western Carriage Inn. Nice rooms well maintained and cleaned. The swimming pool was on the warm side. Location of the Best Western is very central and the best thing is Denny's is right next door.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, kudos to the cleaning staff, as the room was immaculate. Now the negatives: The fan in the bathroom didn't work. The hair dryer produced a little puff of air that was a little warmer than room temperature. My hair usually takes five minutes to dry. Here it took half hour. The worse was a loud pounding in the wall that we assume was caused by a water pipe that wasn't wrapped or whatever they do with them so they don't pound when someone turns on the water. It pounded intermittently until about 1 am, then began again about 6, meaning we had very little sleep. Parking is extremely difficult, as the lot isn't large enough. If you arrive there late at night, you'll have to park in the driving area, meaning you risk someone backing into you when they back out of their space.
reviews.title: It Appears They're Skimping on a Few Things

reviews.text: All in all, it appeared that management is trying to skimp on things in order to save money. Not a terribly good value, at least for us.
reviews.title: Liked this place

reviews.text: Stayed a week with son last summer. Enjoyed it. Clean n friendly front desk. Helpful attitude. Only complaint is the location; far from everything. Sepulveda is a main road into LA. Legendary traffic jams cramped my style, but thats part of the experience. That's the trade off for value. Recommend.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, good location for Hollywood

reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights, having to adjoining rooms. Arrived just after checkin (3PM) and everything was ready. Really helpful staff who answered all questions with a smile and supplied us with new glasses, coffe etc when we asked for it. The grounds are nice with trees and very pretty at night with lighting on them. Nice clean pool with ample supply of pool towels. Free coffee in the lobby (fancy coffee machine) until 10AM every day. Relatively fast WIFi, also in the outside areas (e.g.. pool).
reviews.title: Best of the Best.

reviews.text: I stayed at three best westerns over a week long vacation in Hollywood with my family, this was the first best western to recognize me as a gold crown member, I was very pleased. We were checked in by Sandra who was very professional, she helped us promptly and informed us of how the area worked, where there was food, how to get to our room, wifi access, the pool the whole nine yards so we couldn't have to be calling later to find out where to go for what; very much appreciated. We also had the luxury of meeting the General Manager Eric who was more than accommodating, offering us information on tours, Hollywood secrets, all the best for someone who has never been there before. Our room was very clean and up to standards, it was nice sized and the amenities were great, the maid who serviced our room daily did a stellar job and we were very pleased. Last but not least, the hidden Jem of the hotel Anne. Anne is the reason we loved the hotel so much, she was more than accommodating and gave us a large insight into the city, we'll be back and we can't wait to see her again; thank you!
reviews.title: Great location - comfortable room

reviews.text: Our party of 3 stayed in a double queen room for one night before our morning flight back to the east coast. Location-wise, it was great, right off the highway, but it did worry me because the property looked so huge. Part of the property was a motel format, with doors opening out to the outside/balcony, and a building of more conventional hotel rooms. We were given 501, in the building. I was rather confused at first regarding the numbering, but the signs directed us to a corner room on the first floor.
reviews.title: Comfortable, quiet, and clean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once inside, it was well-insulated from noise and appeared clean and orderly. Neutral color scheme was pleasant.
reviews.title: Great location for nearby attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My one complaint was that the very standard bathroom was dated and showing wear and tear. The grab bar "washers" were no longer attached to the wall. The shower head was old and no matter how I adjusted the flow of water (and not an issue of water pressure) so the water just felt like it was "spitting". Nevertheless, I got clean! I appreciated the two sinks, one inside the bathroom and one outside.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in LA!

reviews.text: Other than that, this hotel was fine for our overnight stay. Check in/check out was pleasant and hassle-free. We got to go to a nearby In-n-out burger for dinner. We would consider staying here again for a short stay, but what we noticed was that parking spaces seemed very limited compared to the popularity of this property, and people tend to squeeze every which way, complicating manuevering around the parking lot.
reviews.title: 18 day holiday ruined by accident on dangerous kerb outside pool, no aftercare by hotel management
Very pleasant stay
reviews.text: We were taking a quick one day trip to The Japanese Gardens in Van Nuys and then to The Getty Museum. This motel is ideally located. The front desk service was quick and friendly. Our room was very nice and clean. Beds very comfortable. It is located on a very busy main thoroughfare, so if you are wanting to sleep in and traffic noise disturbs you, this is probably not the best place to stay. However, during the late evening and all night it was quiet. Denny's on the property always is good for breakfast. We would stay again.
